meanings.definition: Scravel (verb): To scrape or scratch with the nails or claws.
meanings.sent1: The cat tried to scravel its way out of the room by scratching at the door.
meanings.sent2: I watched as the gardener used a rake to scravel the soil in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy decided to scravel the sofa, leaving behind a mess of torn fabric.
meanings.sent4: The prisoner felt like he had to scravel his way out of the tough situation.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the nails scraveling against the chalkboard made everyone cringe.

meanings.definition: Scravel (noun): Loose, dry earth or gravel.
meanings.sent1: The children played in the scravel, feeling the tiny rocks under their feet.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers spread scravel on the path to improve traction.
meanings.sent3: The artist used scravel to create a textured effect in the painting.
meanings.sent4: The scravel on the driveway crunched under the weight of the car.
meanings.sent5: The scravel shimmered in the sunlight, creating a beautiful sight.
